enWisdom: Sickness is [a form of] confinement of the body
Milk is one of the two meats
Sickness in one of the two confinements
Many a remedy brings about an ailment
Many an ailment turns into a remedy
Sometimes the ailment is [itself] a cure
Sometimes the remedy is [itself] an ailment

Wisdom: قَلَّ مَنْ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ فُضُولِ الطَّعَامِ إِلَّا لَزِمَتْهُ الْأَسْقَامُ
enWisdom: Seldom does one increase his consumption of excess foods without getting afflicted by sicknesses
How often has [the eating of] one food prevented [the eating of] other foods

Wisdom: كُلُوا الْأُتْرُجَّ قَبْلَ الطَّعَامِ وَبَعْدَهُ فَآلُ مُحَمَّدٍ يَفْعَلُونَ ذَلِكَ
enWisdom: Eat citron before food and after it as the progeny of Muhammad (s) do this
For every sickness there is a remedy
For every living thing there is an ailment

Wisdom: مَنْ كَثُرَتْ أَدْوَاؤُهُ لَمْ يُعْرَفْ شِفَاؤُهُ
enWisdom: One whose ailments are many, his cure will not be known

Wisdom: مَنْ كَتَمَ الْأَطِبَّاءَ مَرَضَهُ خَانَ بَدَنَهُ
enWisdom: One who hides his sickness from the physicians has betrayed his body

Wisdom: مَنْ كَتَمَ مَكْنُونَ دَائِهِ عَجَزَ طَبِيبُهُ عَنْ شِفَائِهِ
enWisdom: Whoever conceals his hidden ailment, his physician becomes incapable of curing him

Wisdom: مَنْ غَرَسَ فِي نَفْسِهِ مَحَبَّةَ أَنْوَاعِ الطَّعَامِ اجْتَنَى ثِمَارَ فُنُونِ الْأَسْقَامِ
enWisdom: One who sows in himself the love of different types of food, reaps the fruit of a variety of maladies

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَحْتَمِلْ مَرَارَةَ الدَّوَاءِ دَامَ أَلَمُهُ
enWisdom: One who does not bear the bitterness of the remedy, his pain persists
